place.name: BAG ENDERBY
place.gazetteerText: ENDERBY (Bag), a parish in Horncastle district, Lincoln; at the source of the river Steeping, 5½ miles NW by N of Spilsby r. station, and 7 ENE of Horncastle. Post town, Harrington, under Spilsby. Acres, 617. Real property, £1, 103. Pop., 81. Houses, 19. The property is all in one estate. The living is a rectory in the diocese of Lincoln. Value, £92. Patron, W. B. Burton, Esq. The church is ancient but good; and the churchyard has an ancient cross. (In 1870-72, John Marius Wilson's Imperial Gazetteer of England and Wales)
